subject: Creativity
title: Internet Comedy: Memes as the New Folk Humor
description: A 60-second lesson on Internet Comedy: Memes as the New Folk Humor.

hook.text: A meme format survives about 4 months before dying. Medieval jesters lasted decades.

buildup.text: Internet memes are the first truly democratic comedy form â€” created by millions, filtered by crowds, spread by shares.

discovery.text: Memes function like folk jokes of the past â€” anonymous, iterative, remixed endlessly.

twist.text: Most meme creators are never credited. Like medieval joke-tellers, they create for the community, not for fame.

climax.text: TikTok compressed comedy to 60 seconds. Twitter compressed jokes to 280 characters. Vine (RIP) did it in 6 seconds.

punchline.text: The internet didn't kill comedy. It just gave everyone a microphone and 6.

quiz.question: How are internet memes similar to medieval folk jokes?
options: Both are anonymous, iterative, and remixed by communities
